    "number": 162307,
    "data": "3,19,31,83,131,223,383,479,643,1279,1823,2131,2239,2579,2819,3331,4483,4639,6163,6719,7103,7699,8963,9631,9859,10559,11779,13331,14143,14419,15263,17939,19843,21503,22531,24659,25759,28031,29599,30803,35423",
    "name": "Primes of the form k*(k+2)/3 - 2, k > 0.",
    "comment": [
        "Or: primes of the form k*(k+1)*(k+2)/(k+(k+1)+(k+2))-2.",
        "Generated by k=3, 7, 9, 15, 19, 25, 33, 37, 43, ....",
        "Primes p such that 3*p+7 is a square. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 05 2015",
        "Primes of the forms 3*k^2 + 2*k - 2 and 3*k^2 + 4*k - 1. - _Robert Israel_, Nov 27 2017"
    ],
    "link": [
        "Robert Israel, <a href=\"/A162307/b162307.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a>"
    ],
    "example": [
        "k=3 contributes a term because 3*(3+2)/3 - 2 = 3 = a(1) is prime."
    ],
    "maple": [
        "select(isprime, [seq(seq((3*j+i)*(3*j+i+2)/3-2, i=0..1),j=1..1000)]); # _Robert Israel_, Nov 27 2017"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "f[n_]:=(n*(n+1)*(n+2))/(n+(n+1)+(n+2))-2; lst={};Do[p=f[n];If[PrimeQ[p], AppendTo[lst,p]],{n,6!}];lst",
        "Select[Table[(k(k+2))/3-2,{k,350}],PrimeQ] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 10 2014 *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(45000) | IsSquare(3*p+7)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 05 2015",
        "(PARI) forprime(p=2, 1e5, if(issquare(3*p+7), print1(p , \", \"))) \\\\ _Altug Alkan_, Dec 05 2015"
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,easy",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jun 30 2009",
    "ext": [
        "Definition simplified by _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 02 2009"
    ],
    "references": 2,
    "revision": 20,
    "time": "2017-11-28T06:43:20-05:00",
